result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Allen Lepkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $810.00 inclusive of all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid today or serve 25 days in the House of Corrections. Bail on deposit to apply.

Huber to apply for work. Court objects to electronic monitoring. Defendant to report for sentencing on 07/06/15.
Court objects to expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Allen Lepkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 2 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court objects to electronic monitoring. Defendant to report for sentencing on 7/6/2015.

Court objects to expungement. 

Fine of $810.00 inclusive of all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid today or serve 25 days in the House of Correction. Bail on deposit to apply.

Received and Filed, Sentencing Referral Form, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and three letters on behalf of the defendant from Garage Floors of Wisconsin.

Defendant Joshua Allen Lepkowski in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Joshua Allen Lepkowski in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Allen Lepkowski
Current: 3159 South Brisbane Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53207   (Effective: 03-23-2015)
Prior: 3159 South Brisbane Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53207

Defendant Joshua Allen Lepkowski in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/23/15 @ 1:30 pm
